result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

02:52 PM. JL-Clerk. Defendant Keven A Hougdahl in court with attorney Donna Burger. Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Def qualifies. Reading waived. Plea NG. Bond cont. 2:54 pm adj  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Not to have contact with: HJH. Allowed one trip with Law Enforcement to residence to obtain personal belongings. May not possess or use firearms. May not possess any hachets. No controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount frequency as prescribed. Must follow any mental health regimen including taking all prescribed medications. Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.

01:15 PM Defendant Keven A Hougdahl appeared by video means. Attorney Travis Satorius appeared by video specially. Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp appeared for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Waives reading. Def did not contact PD to see about qualification. Def is advised of right to obtain counsel. DA requests $250 to $500 cash bond. CT sets bond. If he does not qualify for PD and unable to hire own attorney, must file Petition for Ct Appt attorney by Thursday 3/3/22.  1:27 pm adj.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
